abstract: An option to remove any anchor objects associated with the session’s previous run.
overview:
## Discussion

By default, when you call the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/run(_:options:)] method on a session that has run before or is already running, the session keeps any [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARAnchor] objects that you previously added. That is, objects in the AR scene keep their apparent real-world positions relative to the device (unless you enable the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/RunOptions/resetTracking] option).

Enable the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/RunOptions/removeExistingAnchors] option if changing session configurations should invalidate the apparent real-world positions of objects in the AR scene. For example, if you’ve added virtual content to the AR scene whose positions are correlated to real-world objects, remove those anchors so you can reevaluate appropriate real-world positions. On the other hand, if the virtual content in your scene needs to track real-world positions only when that content first appears and can move freely thereafter, you can disable this option to keep the anchors.

# removeExistingAnchors

**Type Property**

An option to remove any anchor objects associated with the session’s previous run.

## Declaration

```swift
static var removeExistingAnchors: ARSession.RunOptions { get }
```

## Discussion

By default, when you call the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/run(_:options:)] method on a session that has run before or is already running, the session keeps any [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARAnchor] objects that you previously added. That is, objects in the AR scene keep their apparent real-world positions relative to the device (unless you enable the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/RunOptions/resetTracking] option).

Enable the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/RunOptions/removeExistingAnchors] option if changing session configurations should invalidate the apparent real-world positions of objects in the AR scene. For example, if you’ve added virtual content to the AR scene whose positions are correlated to real-world objects, remove those anchors so you can reevaluate appropriate real-world positions. On the other hand, if the virtual content in your scene needs to track real-world positions only when that content first appears and can move freely thereafter, you can disable this option to keep the anchors.

## Run Options

- **resetTracking**: An option to reset the device’s position from the session’s previous run.
- **stopTrackedRaycasts**: An option to stop all active tracked raycasts.
- **resetSceneReconstruction**: An option to reset the scene mesh.
